page.title: 10EAST LEAKE BANTAMS F.C.
page.content: The club was formed in 1974 and has a membership of boys between the age of 9 and 16. There are seven teams,each with its own manager.All the managers are volunteers who give their time freely. Some of the teams are sponsored by local people. Matches are played mainly on Sunday mornings but training,under floodlights at the British Gypsum Plaster Board ground,takes place once per week. The club has been most successful,not only in winning leagues and cups,but in maintaining a high membership. The ground used contains two pitches, has a pavilion and is rented from the council. The members of the club live,not only in East lEake,but in the area surrounding the village.
